question: What is the difference between weather and climate?

answers:
X There is no difference
X Weather or weather forecast refers to the climate that will exist in the future, and climate refers to the physical description of a set of variables such as temperature, wind, precipitation, etc. at a given time.
V The weather is the state of the atmosphere at a given time, defined by the various meteorological elements. The climate is the synthesis of the meteorological conditions in a particular place, characterized by long-term statistics of the meteorological elements in this place

title: Q5 Was ist der Unterschied zwischen Wetter und Klima? (de-en)
explanation: Weather is the state of the atmosphere (precipitation, temperature, etc.) on a particular day or days at a specific location. Klima is known as i.d.R. from a period of at least 30 years.
